direction.raw_text: Building bathrooms. Is he still on campus? Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone? One student sitting next to Stacy raises his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Desmond?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw him by the food machines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long ago?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just before class, sir... Mr. Hand snaps his fingers, Hawaii Five-O style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Bring him in. Desmond hustles out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this fascination with truancy? What is it that gets inside your heads? Mr. Hand begins to pace the aisles as he speaks. Occasionally, for emphasis, he bends down to lecture directly into the students' faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are other teachers in this school who look the other way at truants. (points to attendance clip on the doorway) It's a little game that you both play. They pretend they don't see you, you pretend you don't ditch. Who pays the price later? You. Desmond returns to the room with a red-eyed Jeff Spicoli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Wait a minute! There's no birthday party for me here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Desmond. (to Spicoli) What's the reason for your truancy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't make it in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in top form) You mean, you couldn't? Or you wouldn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, mon. The food lines took forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Food will be eaten on your time! (pause) Why are you continuously late for this class, Mr. Spicoli? Why do you shamelessly waste my time like this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Mr. Hand appears mesmerized. He then turns and heads for the board. He writes in long, large letters as he slams the chalk into the green board. He writes: "I DON'T KNOW".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like that. He stands back and admires it. He turns randomly to Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you like that, Miss Hamilton?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really like that too. 'I don't know'... that's nice. 'Mr. Hand, will I pass this class?' 'Gee, Mr. Spicoli, I don't know'. I like that. I think I'm going to leave your words on this board for all my classes to enjoy. Giving you full credit, of course, Mr. Spicoli. We hear the blare of the dismissal bell. Stacy and the other students get up to leave. Spicoli stays in place. He has just figured out a truly bitchin' comeback... and his mouth is forming the first word, when Mr. Hand cuts him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can go now. Hand turns back to his desk. The rest of the students have already left. Spicoli's audience is gone. He shrugs and lopes out the door. INT. RIDGEMONT MALL - AFTERNOON It's Christmas time at the Ridgemont Mall. All three tiers are strung with neon lights, and we hear the sound of the bell-ringing Santas. INT. SWENSON'S - AFTERNOON Stacy and Linda are enjoying a brief lull in the Christmas season madness. They sit at the sundae bar. Stacy looks forlorn, almost red-eyed, as she makes a sundae.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got to get used to working Christmas. People are always screaming and yelling... then they get home and they're all Christmasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think Christmas brings out the worst in people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess Ron hasn't called yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not since November. Linda nods her head, always the coach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy, it doesn't look good for the relationship. Stacy continues making her ice cream, slapping the scoops onto the stainless steel dish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sighs) Don't you think it meant anything to him. Even if I am fifteen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy. What does it matter? He's a stereo salesman. You want to marry him? You want to have kids with him? You want this guy to come home, fifty years old, and he's still got that little Pacific Stereo badge on? Come on. ANGLE ON GREGG AND CINDY who are seated at a back table, feeding each other. Stacy looks at her finished sundae.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should quit this job. I'm going to get so fat working here... nobody will ever take me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy. How many times do I have to tell you? You are really going to be beautiful... someday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks a lot. Linda punches Stacy lightly on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- Ron Johnson? It's his loss. We follow Stacy, as she walks into the dining room to serve the sundae. INT. WHEREHOUSE RECORDS - MALL - DAY We see a group of buzz-cut young toughs, walking in formation, hunched over, sneering and wearing sleeveless U.S. Army fatigue jackets. None of these damaged-looking kids is over the age of fourteen. They pass to reveal this legend on their backs: LINCOLN SURF NAZIS. Angle on Mike Damone and Mark Ratner, who are standing by the upcoming concert list posted on the door to Wherehouse Records. Damone sees the Surf Nazis pass, turns to Mark Ratner, who is still wearing his Cinema Four jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The business is changing, Rat. I'll tell you, these kids today... they don't even listen to Aerosmith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear they all dress like that at Lincoln now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There used to be three or four of those guys. Now we see 'em every time we come to the mall. Damone is approached by a couple of young ticket Customers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got any Blue Oyster Cult tickets?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No Cult. I ate twenty-four pairs of Blue Oyster Cult tickets last time around. I was this close to working at 7-11. No Cult. Suddenly we see all ticket business stop. Damone and his customers see someone menacingly coming directly for them. The small crowd parts as Charles Jefferson, football duffel bag in hand, walks up. With him is a thick, tough, miniature version of himself. This is Little Charles. They both stop in front of Damone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after long look) When is Earth, Wind and Fire coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (respectfully) I'm really not sure. I haven't heard anything yet, but I'll let you know the second there is the slightest news, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking my little brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. So that will be two tickets... All right. Fine, sir. Jefferson and L.C. push past the customers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. He really lives here. I thought he just flew in for the football games.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gaining composure) Shit, he's my man. He knows where to come for tickets. Damone turns to The Rat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Rat. Are you ready for the moment of truth? The Rat adjusts his jacket, and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is immune to my charms. They walk together towards Swenson's, as The Rat drapes his aqua-blue Cinema Four jacket around his shoulders, like a French film director. Damone walks a few steps, then stops Rat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Rat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ace the jacket. The Rat considers the suggestion, gets rid of the jacket. They continue towards Swenson's. EXT. SWENSON'S - DAY The Rat pulls open the door to Swenson's. He walks toward the counter to Stacy Hamilton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. May I help you? The Rat feels the beginnings of cold panic, but barges through nonetheless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I have two questions. I was curious... His voice becomes a shade deeper. He begins to pull The Attitude together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you do with the jackets people leave here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) We keep them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You keep them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We keep them, in case the people come back. She reaches under the counter and pulls out a cardboard box with some rumbled jackets and other items.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here they are. You can look through it, if you want. The Rat chuckles to himself, struggling with The Attitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's cool. It would take too much time to go through all that stuff. I'll just pick up a new one. Stacy smiles. He's obviously awkward, and she likes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your other question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My other question is... can-I-have your-phone-number-so-I-can-ask-you out-sometime? To The Rat's surprise, Stacy continues smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a pen? This one's out of ink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... yes. He pulls one out of his jacket pocket, gives it to her. Stacy writes her name and phone number on a scrap of paper and gives it to him. The Rat looks at the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy. Nice to meet you, Stacy. My name is Mark Ratner. He sticks out his hand, and they shake. We see The Rat turn around and walk out of Swenson's. EXT. SWENSON'S - AFTERNOON The Rat exits with ultimate cool. He sees Damone waiting just off to the side, talking to some girls. The Rat nods, gives him the thumbs-up. Damone returns the gesture. All-Attitude. EXT. CARL'S JR. - MORNING Carl's is happening tonight. There are lots of kids inside. We hear charging rock music -- "Girls Got Rhythm" by AC/DC -- coming from a radio in the back kitchen. INT. CARL'S JR. BATHROOM - MORNING Inside the bathroom, Brad Hamilton applies the Carl's scrub brush to a felt tip graffiti message near the mirror: I EAT BIG HAIRY PUSSY. He pauses and catches himself in the mirror. He adjusts his hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (talking to mirror) Lisa? I have something to tell you. Look, I'm a senior now. I'm a single, successful guy and I've got to be fair to myself. Lisa... I think I need my freedom. Brad pauses, looks at the mirror soulfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, don't do that... don't take it personally, okay? Please? I knew you'd understand, because... The bathroom door opens -- it's Arnold, the boy who Brad got a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brad! I know you're on your break, but would you cover me on register three? Brad nods, exits: INT. CARL'S JR. COUNTER Brad stands at the register. We see a prominent display over Brad's head: TRY OUR 100% GUARANTEED BREAKFAST. The last of many harried businessmen customers gets his breakfast order and takes his seat. Brad is joined by Dennis Taylor, the Assistant Manager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Clean that counter off Brad. Let's go. Play ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Dennis. Brad begins polishing the counter and Dennis Taylor returns to his office at the back of the kitchen. Brad watches him disappear behind the door that says: ASSISTANT MANAGER. As soon as Dennis disappears behind the door, the one Businessman in the place rises and returns to the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nervously) May I help you? The Businessman has short, curly brown hair. He speaks in a whine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. This is not the best breakfast I ever ate. The Businessman points to the huge display over Brad's head: TRY OUR 100% GUARANTEED BREAKFAST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I want my money back. Brad begins searching under the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I believe you have to fill out a form. There's a pad right around here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I want my money back right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's not the way it works, really. And you ate most of your food already, too...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See that sign? It says 100% Money Back Guarantee. Do you know the meaning of the word 'guarantee'? Do they teach you that here? Give me my money back. Brad begins looking to the restroom. "Where's Arnold?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do that. But if you wait a minute...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as if talking to a kindergartner) Look. Just put your little hand back in the cash register and give me my $2.75 back. Okay? (looks at name tag) Please, Brad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir. Just let me find the forms here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am so tired. I am so tired of dealing with morons. How hard is it to... Brad looks up from under the counter. No amount of pay will make him take that kind of insult.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister, if you don't shut up, I'm gonna kick 100% of your ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Manager!! "Bam!" The door to the Assistant Manager's office swings open, and Dennis comes hurtling out of the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you, sir? Is there a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet there's a problem! Your employee used profanity and threatened me with violence! I'm shocked, frankly. I've eaten here many times and I've always enjoyed the service -- until today! Angle on bathroom door as it opens and Arnold starts towards the register. He quickly sees the incident with the irate Businessman and ducks back inside the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I wanted was my money back for this breakfast. It was a little undercooked. And this young man threatened me. Now I plan to write a letter! I plan to... Dennis wheels around to Brad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you threaten this man or use profanity in any way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He insulted me first. He called me a moron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you threaten this customer or use profanity in any way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fired. Brad looks around, expecting his friends to defend him. Dave and Rich seem very occupied with their work. Brad is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Businessman) I'm very sorry this happened to you, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you very much. Then Brad unhooks his fryer's apron and throws it on the counter. He grabs a backpack and walks out of the place. On the way, he bangs the bathroom door with his fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you had a hell of a piss, Arnold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you please give a warm welcome to... Jeff Spicoli! The Merv Griffin Show band begins playing a Merv Griffin Show version of AC/DC's "Highway to Hell". Someone hands Jeff Spicoli a microphone. He works the studio audience into a frenzy as he sings the words to "Highway to Hell": Merv Griffin show style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (singing) 'Layin' ladies! Drinkin' wine! You gotta dollar -- You're a friend of mine! Gettin' loose! Feelin' fine! You and me -- It's get down time! We're on the Highway to Hell! The Highway to Hell!' Spicoli finishes up with a spectular pump. The audience goes wild as Merv Griffin greets him warmly, and guides Spicoli to his seat. Spicoli motions for the cheers to die down. Griffin is obviously happy to see him. He touches Spicoli's arm lightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How've you been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outrageous, Merv. Nice to be here. I feel great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going to say... your eyes look a little red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been swimming, Merv. The audience howls. It's a famous Spicoli line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously, Merv, everything is great. I was thinking about picking up some hash this weekend, maybe going up to the mountains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (concerned) I wanted to talk a little bit about school, if I could...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: School. (sighs) School is no problem. All you have to do is go to get the grades. And if you know something, all you have to do is go about half the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How often do you go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't go at all. The audience is howling again. He is Merv's favorite guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear you brought a film clip with you. Do you want to set it up for us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it pretty much speaks for itself. Peter, you want to run with it? EXT. A MASSIVE WAVE - DAY The film clip begins. It is a mammoth wave cresting against the blue sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merv, this is the action down at Sunset Cliffs at about six in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fascinating. A tiny figure appears at the foot of the wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's me, Merv. The audience gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to ride that wave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Totally. We watch as Spicoli catches the perfect wave, and it hurtles him through a turquoise tube of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going through your mind right here, Jeff? The danger of it all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merv, I'm thinking... I've only got about four good hours of surfing left before these little clowns from junior high start showing up with their boogie boards. The audience is howling once again... when suddenly we hear the loud noise of a door opening, followed by a shrill voice. It is Spicoli's eight-year-old brother, Curtis. Jeff Spicoli's dream of glory evaporates. INT. SPICOLI'S TRAILER HOME - MORNING It is a messy trailer, part of a trailer park by the sea. Spicoli's area is small, but he has made it his own. The walls are covered with posters, almost all of them naked centerfolds. It is obvious Spicoli's parents are not welcome in his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad says you have to get up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh. He groans, starts to struggle out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad says you're late again, you butthole!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad says! Spicoli reaches over to the floor next to his bed. He pulls a snorkel from the mess, heaves it at the door and his little brother. It bounces off the wall and doesn't even hit Curtis, but the kid starts crying anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daaaaaaaad! Jeff threw a snorkel at me!!!!!! Spicoli gets out of bed, groans again, and kicks the door shut. EXT. RIDGEMONT GYMNASIUM celebrating the big game with rival Lincoln High School. We see Jeff Spicoli stumble from the direction of the parking lot. He heads into the gym, which is already full for a mandatory assembly. INT. GYMNASIUM - DOORWAY - DAY Spicoli wanders into the assembly, takes a seat on a corner bleacher. He sits just below Brad Hamilton and Lisa. On podium in front of assembly, Cindy Carr and another cheerleader, Dina Phillips, are making a presentation before the school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want to say that we are not 'Spirit Bunnies' anymore. We always hated that name. It bugged the heck out of Dina and me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just such a put down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't call the Chess Club 'Checker Champs' or anything like that. We're going to go to everything this year, you guys. We're going to go to soccer, wrestling, basketball... everything. We know you've got a lot of spirit! Everybody -- riiiiiight? And we're gonna destroy Lincoln next week? Riiiiiiight? ANGLE ON THE STUDENTS OF RIDGEMONT They don't respond. ANGLE ON JEFF SPICOLI who is asleep in the bleachers. ANGLE ON BRAD AND LISA sitting nearby. We hear them over the drone of the assembly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, I don't even want to see those guys from Carl's again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'd apologize I think Dennis would take you back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apologize to that wimp? No way. Fuck Dennis Taylor. They sit in silence for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just glad we're still together, Lisa, because I need you this year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sighs) Look, Brad, I've been trying to think of a way to tell you this. We're almost out of high school, this is our last year. I think we owe it to ourselves to be free, and meet some new people. Then, if we get back together, we'll know it's the right thing. TIGHT ANGLE ON BRAD'S FACE as he accepts the news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I still want to be friends. TIGHT ANGLE ON BRAD'S FACE as it falls slack. INT. GYM - PODIUM IN FRONT OF ASSEMBLY CINDY We're going to be going to every game this year. We just want the crowd to participate and we want spirit from every little person in this entire school. Allll-Riiiight? There is unenthusiastic, minor applause from the assembled students of Ridgemont High. Vice Principal Ray Connors, a tough-looking man with an H.R. Haldeman crew cut, approaches the podium. He has a sour look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thank you, girls. People, don't forget, the big game is one week away. We'll see everybody back here on Monday and have a good weekend. For the first time during this assembly, there is a loud and hearty applause. A GRAINY HIGH SCHOOL FILM 57 We are suddenly watching a movie shown on a class projection screen. We see footage of a serene, middle-class neighborhood -- as seen through the glass windshield of a car. Judging from the other vehicles parked on the street, the film is from the early Sixties. We hear the narrative voice of Desi Arnaz, speaking in his inimitable Latin accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driving ess an important part of each and every one of our da-ily lives. Ees a responsibility like no o-ther and ess a matter of life and... A ball comes rolling out into the serene street. A small child runs out after it. The driving of our vehicle brakes, but not in time. The film freeze frames on the terrified face of a child about to be splattered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death. There is a swell of dramatic music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have foun'... The Braking Point. The words flash on the screen and we hear a high school Driver's Training class groan in mock horror. INT. DRIVER TRAINING CLASS - DAY ANGLE ON CHARLES JEFFERSON AND BRAD HAMILTON who are seated in this class. ANGLE ON LINDA AND STACY sitting together in the class. They are oblivious, lost in conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think of that guy who works at the theatre? You know, Mark Ratner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, come on. What is he? Fifteen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixteen. Linda looks nauseous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just watch out if he pulls up in a van, and then puts on a Led Zeppelin tape. INT. DRIVER TRAINING CLASS The film returns to another serene street scene as seen through another front windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The driver here has had jus' two drinks. Two drinks at the home of a frien'. We hear the very-present sounds of Driver's Training students.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's fucked-up, Ricky!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They guys a drunk, Ricky!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And although this driver thinks he ees drivin' well, he may be 'doing okay, but he forgets to per-ceive what ees real goin' on... In the film, another car comes barreling from the left, running a stop sign and exploding into the side of the two-drink goner. In the class, the Driver's Training students are howling. EXT. RIDGEMONT MALL - EARLY EVENING The parking lot is full. Kids and shoppers stream through the entrance in groups of all sizes. INT. RIDGEMONT MALL All three levels are teeming with kids. ANGLE ON THE VIDEO PINBALL ARCADE where we see Jeff Spicoli manning the Missile Command machine. Spicoli wears a red bandana across his forehead. A cigarette dangles from his mouth. He is surrounded by a fleet of young surfers who listen to him with reverence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be noble. Be aggressive. The thing about Missile Command is to decimate before you can be decimated. Just like in real life. The youngsters hang on every word of the sage advice. ANGLE ON A GANG OF SURF NAZIS walking in formation. ANGLE ON MIKE DAMONE AND MARK RATNER walking the mall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Check it out, Rat. The Surf Nazis... out for a Sunday stroll. Damone and The Rat walk on. The Rat is barely interested. He appears deep in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do I say after she gets in the car? Damone, obviously in his element here at the mall, stops to flash a winning smile at a well-built older housewife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem, Rat. What you need is my special Five Point Plan. As he talks, Damone passes a Country Farms shop. He plucks a free sample of cheese and sausage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knock it off, Damone. I need real help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? Men have died trying to obtain this information. I will give it to you for free. The Rat and Damone continue on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Tell me. What's the Five Point Plan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Pay attention. The Rat nods, always the student, as they pass a Wherehouse Record store. Damone stops right in front of a seductively posed life-sized cardboard stand-up of Debbie Harry, the alluring rock singer. Damone begins his speech.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First of all, Rat... never let on how much you like a girl. Damone turns to the cardboard cutout of Debbie Harry to demonstrate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (disinterested) Oh. Hi. (turns back to The Rat) ) Two. Always call the shots. He turns to Debbie Harry, who looks on with an inviting cardboard smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiss me. (to The Rat) Three. Act like wherever you are, that's the place to be. (to Debbie Harry; debonair) ) Isn't this great? (to The Rat) Four. When ordering food, find out what she wants and then order for both of you... it's a classy move. (to Debbie Harry; Cary Grant) And the lady will have... (to The Rat) Five. And this is most important. When you get down to making out, whenever possible, put on the first side of Led Zeppelin IV. (to Debbie Harry; seductive) Why don't you put this tape on? It sounds great in the back of my van... why don't we listen from there? ANGLE ON DEBBIE HARRY with the same inviting smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that is how you talk to a girl, Rat. Voila. You can't miss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I've got it. Once I get going, I'll be okay. But... how do I get started? I mean, I hardly know her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wuss. It's no problem. One person says something to the other and that's how it starts... Standing there in the front of the Wherehouse, The Rat nods his head and smiles. He's finally beginning to understand, and we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for coming to get me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure thing. Silence. EXT. THE RAT'S CAR He rounds the corner of Luna Street, off the neon fast-food stand that is Ridgemont Drive. INT. THE RAT'S CAR Yet another silence has fallen. Then, after a time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a nice car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It's my sister's. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have Mrs. George for English?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. She is pretty good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. She is pretty good. EXT. ATLANTIS RESTAURANT - NIGHT They pull into the parking lot of a steak and lobster house called The Atlantis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joey at Cinema Four said this is a pretty good restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard that, too. The Rat finds a parking spot near the back of the lot, grateful that the long silence is over. He walks with Stacy to the front of The Atlantis. INT. THE ATLANTIS - NIGHT The Rat and Stacy are escorted by the host to a nearby table. They are given large wooden menus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'll have the Seafood Salad Special.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. The Rat leans back in the booth. He is starting to feel in control now. Then something hits him. The panic sweeps across his face. Slowly, The Rat reaches back to check his wallet. It's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (weakly) Oh yeah. Cool. Cool was the name of the game. Stay cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you mind if I excuse myself for a moment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all. Just as The Rat is about to get up, the Waitress approaches the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ready to order here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... sure. (settles back down) She will have the Seafood Salad Special. And I will have... the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything to drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two Cokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Thanks. The Rat gets back up again, looking paler by the minute. He excuses himself and walks over to the pay phone by the Atlantis toilets. The Rat dials a number. Damone answers. INT. DAMONE'S ROOM - NIGHT He is sitting in a chair, leaning onto the back two legs, watching television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damone. It's Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark. What happened to your date?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's happening right now. I'm here at the Atlantis. Everything's fine except... I left my wallet at home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you go home and get it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's too late. The food is coming and everything. Damone, I've got to ask you this favor, and I'll never ask you for anything again in this lifetime or any other. Will you please borrow your mom's car, go by my house, get my wallet, and meet me back here? There is silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damone, are you there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (world-weary sigh) I'm really pretty busy... ANGLE ON DAMONE'S TELEVISION as we see the flickering images of Leave It To Beaver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You owe me for this one. INT. ATLANTIS The Rat hangs up, mildly relieved, and returns to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure there's nothing else I can bring you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have one more Coke... Do you want another Coke, Stacy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quizzical) ) Sure. I'll... have another Coke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two more Cokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sarcastic) Two... more... Cokes. ANGLE ON FRONT DOOR as Mike Damone finally walks in. Damone looks over the diners, then feigns great surprise when he sees The Rat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Mark. Is that you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damone! You come here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I come for the seafood. It's great! Hey... you know what, Mark? I found your wallet the other day. You want it back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. I've been looking for that thing! Hey, Damone, have you met Stacy Hamilton? Stacy, this is Mike Damone. Stacy smiles politely, with the slightest sparkle in her eye, as the Waitress returns with the two Cokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I've gotta be running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. See ya. ANGLE ON STACY looking strangely at the proceedings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you, Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you. Damone leaves. The Rat takes a few quick gulps of Coke, and gets up to pay the bill. As he moves out of camera range, we see the strange look on the faces of waitresses and diners. INT. THE RAT'S CAR - LATE EVENING The Rat pulls up to Stacy's house in the cul-de sac. He stares straight ahead, like a zombie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a really nice time tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too. I'm real sorry someone broke in and stole your tape deck. The Rat nods glumly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never thought it would happen at The Atlantis. Jeez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to come inside?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't your parents asleep?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, they're away for the weekend. Brad and I are watching the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Sure. I'll come in. We see a confused but interested look on The Rat's face. INT. THE HAMILTON HOUSE - EVENING They walk in the front door. The Rat stands uncomfortably in the doorway to the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's your brother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Probably out. Want something to drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. That's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm going to change real quick. I hope you don't mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw. I don't mind. Stacy turns her back and pulls up her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you unzip me? ANGLE ON THE RAT'S FACE as the wheels inside his mind start to spin. This can't be what it seems. He unzips Stacy, past her bra, down to the small of her back. It's the first time he's ever done anything like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks! She walks down the hall to her room, easing out of her dress as she walks. She leaves the door to her room open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can come in, if you want! ANGLE ON THE RAT'S FACE He is completely unsure of himself, as he begins to walk down the hall. His heart pounds into his throat. He turns the corner and steps into Stacy's room. INT. STACY'S ROOM - NIGHT Stacy stands there, looking gorgeous in an almost seethrough white robe. The Rat pretends not to notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... pretty nice house you've got here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. So... (puts hands on hips) What do you want to do? ANGLE ON THE RAT'S FACE as he struggles with the memory of Damone's words. "Always call the shots."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to see some pictures? I kept a lot of scrapbooks and pictures and stuff from junior high. How stupid, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Stacy goes to her closet, reaches up to grab the books from the top shelf. The Rat watches her robe slip up her legs. Then she sits down next to him. Her knee grazes his. It is almost too much for The Rat. Go for it. We see The Rat struggle with the action of putting his arm around her. He almost does, but then reacts as she says suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is me in the eighth grade. Did you have Mr. Deegan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking pained) Oh, yeah. I had Mr. Deegan. Her knee grazes him again. Does she expect something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Stacy, I want you to know that... The Rat struggles. Try as he might, he can't seem to cross the line. He can't make his move. He is woeful as he completes the sentence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I've got to go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you really have to go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... it's getting kind of late. Suddenly, The Rat is seized with ambition. He reaches one hand around her right shoulder and plants the other hand directly on her left breast. It looks something like a wrestling hold. The Rat looks at Stacy. Stacy looks back at The Rat. The Rat is absolutely frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess it is getting late, Mark. She shrugs him off, walks him to the door. EXT. THE HAMILTON HOME - NIGHT We see The Rat's forlorn face as he trudges towards his car. He stops. He takes a breath -- it wasn't that late, he really didn't want to leave. The Rat turns and begins walking back up the Hamilton steps. Just as he does so, Stacy's bedroom light clicks off. It was too late. He kicks at his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You blew it, asshole. Behind him, recklessly speeding towards Ridgemont Drive, is Charles Jefferson's blue Mustang. EXT./INT. THE BLUE MUSTANG - NIGHT Jeff Spicoli is behind the wheel. Sitting next to him is Little Charles, "L.C.", Jefferson's younger brother. They're smoking grass and holding Lowenbrau beers in between their legs. The radio is blasting the music of Rick James. L.C. Hey, slow down. This is my brother's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he was out of town. L.C. He is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then don't hassle it. They speed off down Ridgemont. L.C. Seen the new Playboy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw. Any good? L.C. Suzanne Somers' tits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. L.C. I like sex. Spicoli sees something in the rearview mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold your beer down, L.C., I think it's a cop. Spicoli slows down. The car behind him slows down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a cop. He's definitely cruising me at busting distance. The high beams switch on behind Spicoli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is this guy doing? The car behind Spicoli then advances to the point where it is now almost touching the blue Mustang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is this guy doing? L.C. This ain't no cop. The mystery car bumps them lightly from behind. L.C. (CONT'D) Hey! He's gonna scratch my brother's car! The two boys start yelling. High beams fill the Mustang with bright light and... EXT./INT. MUSTANG AND GRANADA Then mystery car pulls back, then up alongside Spicoli and L.C. on the left. We hear the music on the radio of George Thoroughgood's "Ride On, Josephine".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a bunch of Jocks in a Granada! L.C. They're fuckin' with us. The drivers of the two cars eye each others. Then the Granada begins inching over, trying to force Spicoli off the road. L.C. (CONT'D) My brother's car!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Die, Granada Jocks! Spicoli guns ahead, in a real bullet move, and easily overtakes the Granada. Spicoli is proud of himself. He checks himself out in the rearview and turns to L.C.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you roll your window up, L.C.? It's messing my hair. Spicoli pulls way ahead of the Granada, while L.C. rolls his window up. Spicoli looks over to L.C. and smiles wickedly. Now Spicoli wants to show off. He pushes the pedal to the floor. L.C. We just missed the turnoff to the party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the thing I love about Mustangs? The steering wheel. Spicoli fingers the bubbles in the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a genuine Mustang steering wheel, you can negotiate a hairpin turn with ease, my man. EXT./INT. MUSTANG on the word "ease", Spicoli curls his finger into one of the Mustang steering wheel bubbles and whips it clockwise. The idea is to turn off onto a side street and head back to the party. But instead, at the moment of the hairpin turn, L.C. is attempting to switch the radio station. Spicoli crooks his finger farther into the bubble than he expected. The car swings in a complete circle, a circle that includes a bright yellow fire hydrant. The hydrant rips the side of the car open like a can of tuna. There is a silent moment of terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? There is silence. Outside the smashed car, the Granada Jocks pass Spicoli and L.C.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck youuuuuuuuuu! Then L.C. stirs and utters his first words. L.C. My brother is going to kill us. He's gonna kill you and then he's gonna kill me. He's gonna kill us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just be glad you're all right. L.C. My brother is gonna shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make up your mind. Is he gonna shit, or is he gonna kill us? L.C. First he's gonna shit. And then he's gonna kill us..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you just relax, mon? He's not gonna kill us. My father is a television repairman. He's got all kinds of tools. I can fix-this car. L.C. You can't fix this car, Spicoli. ANGLE ON THE BLUE MUSTANG waffled and mangled. It is just inches away from scrap iron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can fix it. MONTAGE OF SHOTS as we see Ridgemont High gearing up for its big Homecoming Game against Lincoln. We see a series of shots of kids talking about it, wagering on the chances of a Ridgemont victory. We see the many signs and placards all over school, proclaiming Ridgemont revenge. We see students lining up to vote for Homecoming King and Queen in the gymnasium. It is the most spirit that Ridgemont has shown this year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Brad! How's going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you working?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fish and chips place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a fish and chips place. Brad says nothing more. The students look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be seeing you, Brad!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sullen) Later. EXT. FOOTBALL FIELD - THE GAME - NIGHT Everyone is cheering the amazing game on the field. Charles Jefferson is poised on the offensive line. He mutters a string of obscenities at the opposing Lincoln player. The ball is snapped, and Charles Jefferson comes directly at the player with both elbows up and angled to hit inside his helmet. The Lincoln player is hit and keels over. Charles Jefferson sets up for another play. The ball is snapped. Ka-boom. Down falls another Lincoln player. Jefferson doesn't know who it was who wrecked his Mustang, but he wasn't about to spare any of them. There is pure madness in his eyes. It has taken him over. The Ridgemont points rack up. Jefferson is single handedly maiming Lincoln for Homecoming. EXT. RIDGEMONT BLEACHERS - NIGHT We see Jeff Spicoli and L.C. sitting calmly in the bleachers, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we may have gotten away clean. EXT. FIELD AND SCOREBOARD The half-time gun fires and the score is 36-7... Ridgemont. Even the Ridgemont players steer clear of Charles Jefferson as they return to their locker room. EXT. THE HAMILTON POOL - HOT AFTERNOON - SEVERAL WEEKS LATER Linda and Stacy are sitting by the pool, dressed in string tie bathing suits. They are listening to the music of Tom Petty's "Breakdown" playing on the living room stereo. Linda luxuriously applies suntan lotion to her chest and legs, in long and writhing strokes. Stacy reads a book. It's called Total Orgasm. Several beats pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sent a letter to Doug today. I'll be so glad when he gets out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (engrossed in book) You really ought to look at this, Linda. There's a drawing on every page... and all these quizzes. It's like school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you put your mother's secret book back? Linda continues regally applying lotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to this... 'What are your mate's three most erogenous zones?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (automatic) Okay, penis, that's one, balls...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't penis and balls be the same category?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. Probably penis, mouth and neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right! Here's another one. 'The most satisfactory lovemaking occurs when your mate climaxes first, you climax first, you and your mate climax together?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climax together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does that ever happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But it's a nice idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to this ... it says 'Most women derive pleasure from sex, but they don't have real orgasms.' Linda stops applying lotion, considers that thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... they obviously don't know about Doug. They laugh. Linda resumes applying the lotion. Stacy continues reading the book. A couple of beats pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long does Doug take?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Thirty to forty minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) What's Doug do in Chicago?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He works for the airline. He'll be out here. You'll meet him. Stacy looks at Linda, almost disbelieving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wistful) He's no high school boy. There is a noise by the side fence leading into the Hamiltons' backyard. It is Mark Ratner and Mike Damone. They are already wearing swimsuits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! We came over to help you with Math homework!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really. We figured you needed the help. On such a hot day. Stacy quickly stashes the book in a stack of towels beside her. She leans over to Linda and speaks confidentially.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think they're both virgins. Stacy smiles, gets up and goes over to the fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't ask for any help. Did you, Linda?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's exactly why I brought some Wisk for the jacuzzi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O-kay, you guys can come swimming. But you have to leave as soon as my Mom gets home. Okay? EXT. HAMILTON POOL Mike Damone yells "banzai!" and dives into the small pool. At one end of the pool is the jacuzzi, which is separated by a tile wall. Damone has already poured the Wisk into the jacuzzi, and the detergent has created a huge bubble bath effect. Damone surfaces and flips into the jacuzzi. Stacy, looking great in a green bikini, sits kicking her legs by the side of the pool. Linda stands on the board. She is poised to dive. The Rat treads water and stares at both girls. Inside the Hamilton living room, the family stereo plays the music of Deep Purple's "Woman From Tokyo".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Linda! I'll judge your dive. I'm a champion diver myself. Brad arrives home by the side gate and slams it behind him. He is home from a bad day at work. He walks out onto the patio and stands with his hands on his hips. For the first time, our former campus hero looks absurd. He is still in his uniform from Captain Kidd Fish and Chips -- it is a blue and white striped Pirates of the Caribbean outfit, complete with black plastic sword at the side, and a ridiculously large Ponce de Leon-esque hat. Brad carries the hat under his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does Mom know you have company?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just Linda. And Mark from school. Brad ignores the underclassmen, and notices Linda on the board in her maroon bikini. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Linda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Brad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you guys, keep it down. I've got some work to do upstairs. Brad turns and heads back inside. He is just out of earshot when they begin talking about him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, he hardly even talks anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. He hates to have to wear uniforms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really. Stacy breaks the spell by jumping into the water, surfacing, and flipping over the tile wall into the Jacuzzi. She sits next to Damone, looking mischievous. ANGLE ON DAMONE AND STACY IN THE JACUZZI talking while the others are at the other end of the pool. ANGLE ON THE RAT casually catching sight of them together from the other side of the pool. We can read the emotions on The Rat's face. He is still taken with Stacy, but his big moment for her appears to have passed. ANGLE ON DAMONE AND STACY IN THE JACUZZI as they talk. Underneath the water, her leg accidentally knocks against his. Then he feels her continue. Damone feels Stacy's cool hand on his inner thigh. Moving upwards, stopping just short of the bulge in his trunks. ANGLE ON DAMONE'S FACE as it loosens and quivers just the slightest bit. This is uncharted territory, even for Mr. Attitude. ANGLE ON LINDA who is now sunning herself by the side of the pool. She rubs her legs against each other, slowly, enjoying the hot afternoon. EXT. BRAD'S WINDOW - ANGLE ON BRAD who is watching Linda from the window in his room. We see him from behind, peeking out the curtains. EXT. POOL - ANGLE ON LINDA who smiles at Damone and flips back into the pool with a splash. Damone steals a look down at his swimsuit. He's popped a big one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you get up and do a dive, Mike?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead. ANGLE ON DAMONE'S FACE and we know he can't get out of the water yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I don't think so. Not right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chicken! Linda, for one, loses interest quickly. Standing by the side of the pool, she jams a finger in her ear and wiggles it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy! I've got water in my ears. Do you have any Q-Tips?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I don't think so. Better look in the house. Linda towels off and heads back inside the Hamilton house. She knows how to walk. INT. BRAD'S BEDROOM AND BATHROOM - AFTERNOON We see Brad's room. The Carl's burger picture on the wall is conspicuously missing. There is music playing from his stereo -- Pink Floyd's "You and Me". We see Brad. He is kneeling on the bathroom floor, his back to us. His green T-shirt is on, his underwear in a pile on the floor behind him. His arm is pumping slowly. Brad is jacking off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Brad. (pause) You know how cute I always thought you were. I think you're so sexy. Will you come to me? ANGLE ON BRAD IN DAYDREAM in a nice shirt, his hair combed back and looking great. He walks to Linda. She reaches out and grabs him for a kiss, pulling him close. Then she pushes him away, so he can watch as she carefully unstraps the top of her bathing suit. The incredible Linda Barrett's breasts fall loose. She takes Brad's hands and places them on her, as she begins unbuttoning his shirt. They are just about to fall into passionate lovemaking when we hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Brad! Do you have any Q-Ti... The daydream evaporates and we see real life again with an... INT. BRAD'S BATHROOM - ANGLE ON LINDA'S FACE in the doorway of Brad's bathroom as she watches the sight before her. ANGLE ON BRAD trying to cover himself and act nonchalant and keep his back turned at the same time. The words barely escape his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait just a... minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. I didn't know anybody was in here. Linda turns and goes immediately, as if she wants to forget what she saw as quickly as possible. She closes the door behind her. ANGLE ON BRAD still kneeling. It had all happened so quickly, so fast
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't anybody fuckin' knock anymore? He slams the toilet seat down and we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now in 1898, Spain owned Cuba. Outright. Think about it. Cuba, owned by a disorganized parliament
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BRAD'S ROOM - DAY He arrives back in his room and locks the door. He yanks the burger picture off his wall, dumps it into the trash. Then he takes it back out of the trash and cracks the cardboard picture and plastic frame in half. DARKNESS We are in the middle of a deep, dark void. After a moment, a pinprick of light appears in the distance. We head towards the light. We are being led somewhere important. As we draw still closer, curtains suddenly part to reveal a wildly cheering studio audience. We hear the voice of Merv Griffin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: PODIUM IN FRONT OF ASSEMBLY CINDY
ON A GANG OF SURF NAZIS
ON MIKE DAMONE AND MARK RATNER

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. THE RAT'S CAR - LATER THAT NIGHT We see The Rat behind the wheel of a green Volvo. Stacy sits beside him. They are driving the streets of Ridgemont. INT. THE RAT'S CAR This is it. The Big Date. "Led Zeppelin IV" is on the car stereo of his sister's van. Finally...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. STACY AND THE RAT'S TABLE - AN HOUR LATER The Rat and Stacy have finished the meal, and desert. ANGLE ON THE CHECK as it sits in a little tray before The Rat. The Waitress approaches the table. It is clear she wants to make room for other customers and bigger tips.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. RIDGEMONT SCHOOL - FLAGPOLE - DAY From the back of the parking lot, we see a crowd around the flagpole. A group of kids are staring at something. They sadly shake their heads at the sight, as if they are witnessing a funeral. As we draw closer, we see the center of commotion. It is an ugly sight. Someone had wrecked Charles Jefferson's Blue Scholarship Mustang and welded it to the flagpole. Spray-painted on the side was the message: LINCOLN SURF PUNKS RULE. EXT. RIDGEMONT BLEACHERS - NIGHT The Ridgemont football bleachers are full of cheering students. We see the same basic groups from lunch court, and many more. The cheerleaders are on the field -- Cindy Carr, Dina Phillips and company -- and their cheerleader "husbands" sit directly in front of them in the stands. Linda and Stacy sit in the bleachers with some of the Swenson's girls. The Rat and Damone sit several rows above them, watching. The teachers sit together in another section. ANGLE ON BRAD HAMILTON who is again sitting alone in the bleachers. Watching. Several old lunch court friends pass by, on their way to the concession area.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. U.S. HISTORY CLASS - DAY The third attendance bell rings, and Mr. Hand strides to the front of the class. He locks the door. Then he takes the front of the class and notices something very different. ANGLE ON JEFF SPICOLI bright and clear-eyed, sitting in the front row. His hands are clasped in front of him on the desk.
